Texto: 
palpable left thyroid nodule.
no treatment needed since symptoms were not severe.
barium swallow reveals a smooth, prominent posterior impression on the cervical esophagus at the c5-6 level.
 
also note the barium in the nasopharynx which occurred during swallowing.  this is a good example of nasopharyngeal reflux with failure of the soft palate and uvula to approximate the posterior pharynx.
cricopharyngeal achalasia
83 y/o female with new left thyroid nodule complains of dysphagia.
